title: Jennifer Aniston the new face of Emirates airline [Photos]
text:
Monday, August 10, 2015 10:33 AM EDT Top celebrity tourism campaigns Previous Next 
We take a look back at the top tourism campaigns featuring celebrities. Jennifer Aniston is the new face of Emirates after signing a reported $5 million deal with the airline. The actor will appear in digital and television campaign materials in her role as spokesperson. Read the full story here. (WENN.com) 
Taylor Swift was announced as the new tourism ambassador for New York City in October 2014. The singer, who lives in New York City, will share her favourite Big Apple experiences with fans around the world and wrote a song called "Welcome to New York." (Courtesy NYC & Company) 
Hotel chain Mandarin Oriental enlisted the help of celebrity "fans" ranging from Lucy Liu to Kevin Spacey to Jane Seymour to star in a new series of print ads. Using the Mandarin Oriental's fan logo as inspiration, the campaign reveals why each celebrity featured is such a fan of the luxury hotel chain. (Courtesy Mandarin Oriental) 
The latest New York state ad campaign -- launched in May for summer 2014 -- features celebrities like Meryl Streep, Vanessa Williams, Billy Joel, Michael Strahan and Ed Burns talking about their favourite places to visit during summer in the state. (WENN.com/Courtesy New York New York Department of Economic Development) 
Star Olympic athlete Usain Bolt appeared in a commercial for his home country of Jamaica in 2010. The slogan of the campaign was "Once You Go, You Know." (Courtesy Jamaica Tourism Board) 
Emeril Lagasse, John Goodman, Wynton Marsalis and Patricia Clarkson promoted tourism in Louisiana in 2006 with the "Fall In Love With Louisiana All Over Again" campaign. (C.Smith/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: C.Smith/ WENN.com 
From 1984 to 1990, Paul Hogan was the face of Tourism Australia for the "Come and Say G'Day" campaign. The catch phrase "I'll slip an extra shrimp on the barbie for you" became incredibly popular. (Courtesy Tourism Australia) 
In 2011, Judi Dench, Twiggy, Dev Patel, Rupert Everett and Jamie Oliver appeared in a commercial for VisitBritain's "You're Invited" tourism campaign. (Courtesy VisitBritain) 
Singer Rihanna shot a commercial in her home country of Barbados in August 2012 for the Barbados Tourism Authority. (WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: WENN.com 
Rock group ZZ Top promoted their favourite destination, Houston, Texas, in a 2009 tourism campaign called "My Houston." (Courtesy Houston Convention & Visitors Bureau) 
In 2007, Robert de Niro, Ivanka Trump, Julianne Moore, Diddy, Jimmy Fallon and Tiki Barber participated in a "Just Ask The Locals" tourism campaign for New York City. (Courtesy NYC & Company) 
Canadian stars gathered to shoot a commercial for Tourism British Columbia's "You Gotta Be Here" campaign in 2010. Steve Nash, Michael J. Fox, Ryan Reynolds, Sarah McLachlan and Kim Cattrall appeared. (Courtesy Tourism British Columbia) 
A slew of celebrities - including Kim Kardashian, Betty White, the Jonas Brothers, Jason Mraz, Jay Leno, Vanessa Williams, Rob Lowe, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Caesar Milan, Marissa Miller and David Beckham - appeared in tourism campaigns for California in 2008 and 2009 with the slogan "Find Yourself Here." (Courtesy California Travel & Tourism Commission) 
South Korean pop singer Psy teamed up with VisitKorea in June 2013 to promote tourism in the country as its international ambassador. Psy appeared in a series of "Wiki Korea" videos to explain popular Korean phrases and highlight tourist destinations across the country. (Courtesy VisitKorea) 
Canadian model Jessica Stam signed up to promote her hometown of Kincardine, Ont. in June 2012. She's reportedly working for free on the campaign. (WENN.com) 
British actor Idris Elba announced in February 2015 that he would embark on an epic road trip from London to Berlin as part of a campaign with Jaguar cars. The journey took him across four countries in three days in wintry conditions. "My work takes me around the world, but I rarely have the time or luxury of getting behind the wheel for myself," Elba said. "I wanted to do this trip and record the experience through a series of short films." (WENN.com) 
Actor Liam Neeson is lending his voice to a St. Patrick's Day tourism campaign from Tourism Ireland. The new video shows iconic scenes of Ireland, as well as landmarks from around the world going green for St. Patrick's Day. "I’m delighted to be helping Tourism Ireland celebrate St. Patrick’s Day," Neeson said in a statement. "It will be wonderful to see the world turn green again on the 17th March as nations come together to celebrate the fun and warmth of the Irish." (YouTube/WENN.com)
